DataElement.preferredName: EQ-5D-3L Questionnaire v1.0 2 Washing or Dressing Self-Care Today Status 3 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of their health state today as related to self-care (washing and dressing), using a 3 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: European Quality of Life Five Dimension Three Level Questionnaire Washing or Dressing Self-Care Today Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale which is used as a measure of health outcome. This instrument is a descriptive system consisting of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 3 levels ranging from no problem to extreme problem or incapable, which are assessed by the patient._A question about an individual's current self-care ability with washing or dressing._A condition or state at a particular time.

Each dimension has 3 levels ranging from no problem to extreme problem or incapable, which are assessed by the patient.

Each dimension has 3 levels ranging from no problem to extreme problem or incapable, which are assessed by the patient.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A three point ordered reference standard that describes current health state related to washing and dressing self-care using the EQ-5D-3L questionnaire.

PermissibleValues.value: I am unable to wash or dress myself

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is unable to wash or dress their self.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is unable to wash or dress their self.

PermissibleValues.value: I have no problems with self-care

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no problems with self-care.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no problems with self-care.

PermissibleValues.value: I have some problems washing or dressing myself
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Some Problems with Washing and Dressing

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Some Problems with Washing and Dressing
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had some problems with washing or dressing their self.

Concepts.longName: Some Problems with Washing and Dressing
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had some problems with washing or dressing their self.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Medidata ePRO CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This CDE has been validated for use with the Medidata Rave ePRO module.
